content.raw:
Somewhat similar to my earlier comment about keeping the typename and identifier on the same line, I think it makes more sense to let `private:` have its own line rather than split the typename away from its identifier.

I understand that our style guide has us not use a newline after declarations of `public:`, `protected:`, and `private:`, but I would personally think that keeping typenames and identifiers together is more important than avoiding a newline after a `private:` declaration. But I guess if there's a precedent for this in our code style, I won't contest it.
content.html:
Somewhat similar to my earlier comment about keeping the typename and identifier on the same line, I think it makes more sense to let private: have its own line rather than split the typename away from its identifier.

I understand that our style guide has us not use a newline after declarations of public:, protected:, and private:, but I would personally think that keeping typenames and identifiers together is more important than avoiding a newline after a private: declaration. But I guess if there's a precedent for this in our code style, I won't contest it.
